net.gotev.uploadservice

Class HttpUploadRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.gotev.uploadservice.HttpUploadRequest
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BinaryUploadRequest, MultipartUploadRequest

    public abstract class HttpUploadRequest
extends Object
    Represents a generic HTTP upload request.
    Subclass to create your own custom upload request.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HttpUploadRequest(Context context, String uploadId, String serverUrl)
      Creates a new http upload request.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpUploadRequest

        public HttpUploadRequest(Context context,
                         String uploadId,
                         String serverUrl)
        Creates a new http upload request.
        Parameters:
        context - application context
        uploadId - unique ID to assign to this upload request. If is null or empty, a random UUID will be automatically generated. It's used in the broadcast receiver when receiving updates.
        serverUrl - URL of the server side script that handles the request

    • Method Detail

      • startUpload

        public final String startUpload()
                         throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                MalformedURLException
        Start the background file upload service.
        Returns:
        the uploadId string
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if one or more arguments passed are invalid
        MalformedURLException - if the server URL is not valid

      • setNotificationConfig

        public HttpUploadRequest setNotificationConfig(UploadNotificationConfig config)
        Sets custom notification configuration. If you don't want to display a notification in Notification Center, either pass null as argument or don't call this method.
        Parameters:
        config - the upload configuration object or null if you don't want a notification to be displayed
        Returns:
        HttpUploadRequest

      • setAutoDeleteFilesAfterSuccessfulUpload

        public HttpUploadRequest setAutoDeleteFilesAfterSuccessfulUpload(boolean autoDeleteFiles)
        Sets the automatic file deletion after successful upload.
        Parameters:
        autoDeleteFiles - true to auto delete files included in the request when the upload is completed successfully. By default this setting is set to false, and nothing gets deleted.
        Returns:
        HttpUploadRequest

        public HttpUploadRequest addHeader(String headerName,
                                   String headerValue)
        Adds a header to this upload request.
        Parameters:
        headerName - header name
        headerValue - header value
        Returns:
        HttpUploadRequest

        public HttpUploadRequest setBasicAuth(String username,
                                      String password)
        Sets the HTTP Basic Authentication header.
        Parameters:
        username - HTTP Basic Auth username
        password - HTTP Basic Auth password
        Returns:
        HttpUploadRequest

                                           List<String> list)

        Returns:

      • setMethod

        public HttpUploadRequest setMethod(String method)
        Sets the HTTP method to use. By default it's set to POST.
        Parameters:
        method - new HTTP method to use
        Returns:
        HttpUploadRequest

      • setCustomUserAgent

        public HttpUploadRequest setCustomUserAgent(String customUserAgent)
        Sets the custom user agent to use for this upload request. Note! If you set the "User-Agent" header by using the "addHeader" method, that setting will be overwritten by the value set with this method.
        Parameters:
        customUserAgent - custom user agent string
        Returns:
        HttpUploadRequest

      • setMaxRetries

        public HttpUploadRequest setMaxRetries(int maxRetries)
        Sets the maximum number of retries that the library will do if an error occurs, before returning an error.
        Parameters:
        maxRetries - number of maximum retries on error
        Returns:
        HttpUploadRequest

      • setUsesFixedLengthStreamingMode

        public HttpUploadRequest setUsesFixedLengthStreamingMode(boolean fixedLength)
        Sets if this upload request is using fixed length streaming mode. If it uses fixed length streaming mode, then the value returned by HttpUploadTask.getBodyLength() will be automatically used to properly set the underlying HttpURLConnection, otherwise chunked streaming mode will be used.
        Parameters:
        fixedLength - true to use fixed length streaming mode (this is the default setting) or false to use chunked streaming mode.
        Returns:
        HttpUploadRequest
